intro: Thrinax aurantia, commonly known as the golden palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean islands and is characterized by its short, clustered stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by orange-red fruits, which contain several seeds. Thrinax aurantia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well adapted to coastal and sandy environments. It is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun.
